Tavatron:

Tavatron's optics fluttered open, her wolfen head still tucked neatly 
between her paws. She slowly raised her head and carefully flexed a paw, 
watching the organic muscles flex and pull beneath her fur. She yawned, 
exposing multiple small, gleaming teeth. Tavatron sighed, she was still 
tired, but her hunger was greater than her need for further rest.

Tavatron's fur rustled softly as she stood, her stomach growling. She closed 
her optics, still not fully awake. Tavatron gasped as a mirage of images 
bombarded her senses. The Alliance, Maximals, Predacons... all lying on a 
broken and charred battlefield...

Tavatron's optics snapped open. What was that? Tav shook her head, 
dispelling the images as quickly as they had appeared. She looked down at 
Dinobot, he looked so... so...

Dinobot lay with a look of emptiness on his face, as if he lived in a world 
of dreamless nights and battle-scarred days. Tavatron sighed, didn't he 
dream? Dream of something better? Something... more?

Dreams of a better life were the only thing that got her through the last 
war. Without her dreams she would have gone offline stellercycles ago.

Tavatron placed a gentle paw on Dinobot's shoulder:

"Dinobot?" Tav whispered. She gently shook him. She didn't know why she 
wanted to wake him, maybe just to be sure he was alive. He had come so close 
to death, and she too close to losing a friend.
